item.title: Quickly check if a process is running or not
item.description: When writting bash scripts one often needs to see if a process is running or not I like the following code; though I’m sure many ways of doing this exists, what’s your favorite? if [ -z "$(pgrep process)" ]; then echo "process is not running" else echo "process is running" fi
